Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Sweden will mandate sexual consent forms.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the proposed changes to the law around rape and sexual assault in Sweden.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on false information and a hoax "sex consent card."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that carrying a signed "sex consent card" will help avoid allegations of rape, which may not necessarily be true.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim has an alternative explanation that the proposed law in Sweden aims to change the requirement of proving physical coercion or threats of violence in order to convict a perpetrator of rape.
